{"step_by_step_thinking": "IDL, or Intermediate Density Lipoprotein, is a type of lipoprotein that is involved in the transport of triglycerides and cholesterol in the body. After VLDL (Very Low Density Lipoprotein) releases its triglycerides, it becomes IDL. IDL can be taken up by the liver or it can be further metabolized to become LDL (Low Density Lipoprotein). Therefore, both statements A and B are correct.", "answer_choice": "C"}
